body: There is ongoing release process of Hadoop 3.2.2. We can remove patch0-HADOOP-16739-branch-3.2.diff if we can use hadoop-3.2.2. We need patch0-revert-HADOOP-16598.diff again instead..
I merged this. Thanks, @elukey.
Tested with CentOS 7, 8 and Fedora 31 on both aarch64 and x86_64.
LGTM ðŸ‘
Thanks! Merged into master and branch-1.5.
Thanks! Merged into master and branch-1.5.
@sekikn feel free to discard this, but would a comment explaining why 600 has been chosen good in this case? Otherwise it looks good :)
@elukey Thanks! I added a comment about that.
Merged into master and branch-1.5. Thank you for reviewing @iwasakims @elukey!

@sekikn I think the PR makes implicit dependency on spark::common which defines Package['spark-core']. Addressing [BIGTOP-3381](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3381) should be the right fix?

> Addressing BIGTOP-3381 should be the right fix?

That's totally right, but it requires to rebuild packages for all distros/platforms and signing them. It will delay our release about a week again... So I'd like to address this issue within the puppet manifest as a workaround at this time. Is this OK for you?
If the RC0 vote fails and we have to rebuild the packages, I'll address BIGTOP-3381.
Updated the PR so that we don't have to specify Spark as a argument for the `--stack` option explicitly.
Thank you for the review, merged into master and branch-1.5.
Trying to merge to check if the website is successfully generated.
Confirmed that the Jenkins job succeeded and "Version" and "Last Published" in the website are updated.
Thanks, @guyuqi. I'm merging this since bigtop-1.5.0 was released. Let me post a patch to upgrade to hadoop-3.2.2 in follow-up JIRA. 3.2.2 will be released in a week.

> May I ask why we upgrade hadoop from 3.2.1 to 3.2.2 not directly to 3.3.3?

I'm assuming some downstream projects depending on hadoop are not ready for hadoop-3.3.0 which contains big changes in transitive dependencies. I think we can release the next bigtop (on hadoop-3.x) early by using 3.2.x. In addition, hadoop-3.2.2 should contain more bug fixes than 3.3.0 (released 9 months ago).

This looks very nice, in my Organization I am tasked to replace HDP cluster with pure opensource. Has it been tested in Ambari 2.7.5? if not I would like to test it.
I
has it been tested in Ambari 2.7.5?

Hi @dongqiu, this Bigtop-Mpack is based on Ambari-2.6.1 and it hasn't been tested based on Ambari 2.7.5 yet . But We did plan to upgrade it to 2.7.x.
By the way, this Mpack just contains some basic components like hdfs, yarn, maprd and Zookeeper. May I ask which components would you like to adopt in your cluster?

@guyuqi, Thanks for getting back.  You guys are fantastic making this mpack release. A few components in one mpack is exactly what we need to build in my area.  I am looking at separate this mpack make it just contain hdfs yarn maprd only, make it hadoop-mapck, and build other multiple mpacks like zookeeper-mpack, hive-mpack, spark-mpack, hbase-mpack etc.. We have use cases in my organization upgrade the full hdp stack failed because hdp stacks are all or nothing upgrade. We are looking at building open source stack with bigtop components, I would very like to contribute on making mpacks and testing on Ambari 2.7.x.

Nice to meet you in Bigtop, @dongqiu
It would be awesome if you join us and contribute more to Bigtop. The mpack is a standalone component under path `bigtop-packages/src/common/bigtop-mpack`
Pls also join the Bigtop-Developer-mailing-list:  dev@bigtop.apache.org.
More details:  https://bigtop.apache.org/mail-lists.html
We can discuss more about features, roadmap and bugfix via this mail list.
Welcome to Bigtop, thanks.

@guyuqi Hi Yuqi, Thanks for the replay i did signed up the mail list.
i am testing with this mpack with newly installed ambari 2.6.1 and run into same issue as below link, The BGTP-1.0 is not showing up in Select Version screen . Can you tell where was issue? 

[https://github.com/apache/bigtop/pull/555#issuecomment-576024282](url)

Steps to test

1. Cloned https://github.com/guyuqi/bigtop-mpack
2. mvn clean package -DskipTests build bgtp-ambari-mpack-1.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-bgtp-ambari-mpack.tar.gz
3. install ambari-server and agent in 4 hosts
4. ambari-server install-mpack --purge --verbose --mpack=/tmp/bgtp-ambari-mpack-1.0.0.0-SNAPSHOT-bgtp-ambari-mpack.tar.gz
5. ambari-server setup
6. ambari-server start, and all agents
7. launch UI and with Wizard and BGTP 1.0 is not available in Select Version screen.

@guyuqi Never mind, the issue is gone when switch to PR 
https://github.com/apache/bigtop/tree/master/bigtop-packages/src/common/bigtop-ambari-mpack/bgtp-ambari-mpack
packaging and smoke-tests worked on CentOS 8 on my local.

+1,
Verified it on Ubuntu 18.04 on x86/Arm64.

I added patch2-exclude-spotbugs-annotations.diff to fix the issue brought by zookeeper-3.4.14.

Thanks for working on this, @guyuqi. There is discussion about dropping Oozie or not in [BIGTOP-3471](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3471). If you still need Oozie, you should declare needs there.

@iwasakims thanks for your comments.

As posted comments on BIGTOP-3471:
if we don't foresee any opposition, let me bump oozie to 5.2.0 rather than drop it.

But before that, let's merged this Pr to fix build Oozie issues which was reported in https://ci.bigtop.apache.org/job/Bigtop-trunk-packages/678/

> Thanks for working on this, @guyuqi. There is discussion about dropping Oozie or not in [BIGTOP-3471](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3471). If you still need Oozie, you should declare needs there.

I'll follow up in there, thanks for the reminder! My team is an heavy user of Oozie, so we'd appreciate to have it fixed or upgraded for the next versions, even if we are planning to move away from it soon-ish in favor of Airflow. Not sure how many people still use Oozie, it could be an interesting thing to send to the users@ mailing list? (I doubt that all users are aware of BIGTOP-3471).
The smoke tests seems to failed in Ubuntu-18.04

@elukey 
Yes, it makes sense.  It's sensible that we would broadcast the definition of bom on `users@` and `dev@`  mailing lists before making the decision.

> The smoke tests seems to failed in Ubuntu-18.04

Yes. We need to fix puppet manifests and smoke-tests as follow-up of [BIGTOP-3280](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3280). I'm addressing only packaging here. I filed [BIGTOP-3477](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3477) for puppet manifests.
The file name patch5-HADOOP-11356.diff implies that it is a diff of HADOOP-11356. Could you rename it to patch5-OOZIE-2733.diff implying the backport of OOZIE-2733.

HBase processes failed to start due to NoSuchMethodError when I launched cluster by docker provisioner. It looks like version mismatch of Guava.
```
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkArgument(ZLjava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/Object;)V
        at org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration.set(Configuration.java:1357)
        at org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration.set(Configuration.java:1338)
        at org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration.setBoolean(Configuration.java:1679)
        at org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser.processGeneralOptions(GenericOptionsParser.java:339)
        at org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser.parseGeneralOptions(GenericOptionsParser.java:572)
        at org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser.<init>(GenericOptionsParser.java:174)
        at org.apache.hadoop.util.GenericOptionsParser.<init>(GenericOptionsParser.java:156)
        at org.apache.hadoop.util.ToolRunner.run(ToolRunner.java:70)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.util.ServerCommandLine.doMain(ServerCommandLine.java:149)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster.main(HMaster.java:2960)
```

```
mvn test -Dzookeeper.version=3.4.14 -Djetty.version=9.3.29.v20201019 -Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true 
```

hbase::
```
mvn test -Phadoop-3.0 -Dhadoop-three.version=3.2.2 -Dslf4j.version=1.7.25 -Djetty.version=9.3.29.v20201019 -Dzookeeper.version=3.4.14 -Dsurefire.testFailureIgnore=true
```

Tested on CentOS 7 and 8.

@sekikn. Should we patch dependencies.gradle in order to set the zookeeper version to 3.4.14? It would be useful to find compilation issue and pull exact transitive dependencies of zookeeper-3.4.14.

```
diff --git a/gradle/dependencies.gradle b/gradle/dependencies.gradle
index 7597b9c52..dab290372 100644
--- a/gradle/dependencies.gradle
+++ b/gradle/dependencies.gradle
@@ -114,7 +114,7 @@ versions += [
   spotbugs: "3.1.12",
   spotbugsPlugin: "1.6.9",
   spotlessPlugin: "3.23.1",
-  zookeeper: "3.5.7",
+  zookeeper: "3.4.14",
   zstd: "1.4.3-1"
 ]
```
Oh, that's right. I mistakenly thought that the zookeeper version was specified in do-component-build just like other components. Thanks!

Updated the PR. I chose rewriting dependencies.gradle in do-component-build rather than putting a patch in bigtop-packages/src/common/kafka, so that we can leverage `$ZOOKEEPER_VERSION` instead of a hard-coded value.
I confirmed the right version of ZK was used by checking the following message, which is output by install_kafka.sh.

```
+ rm -f debian/kafka//usr/lib/kafka/libs/zookeeper-3.4.14.jar
```

Thank you for the contribution @okumurays! I confirmed the PR worked on CentOS 7 and 8, Debian 10 and Ubuntu 18.04.
I noticed `testWordCountBatch` in the smoke tests sometimes failed due to `UnsupportedFileSystemSchemeException` for HDFS when Flink was deployed earlier than Hadoop, but once restarting flink services it succeeded.
We can address it later as another issue, so I'm +1 for this PR.

+1, also checked on CentOS 8 and Debian 10. Thanks @iwasakims.

@qizhu-lucas Sorry for late reply. This has conflicts now. Could you rebase this?

Since Bigtop supports both .rpm and .deb, you need to fix files under bigtop-packages/src/deb/hadoop too. If you don't have environment to test, I can cover them in follow-up JIRA.

I dropped the phoenix-queryserver package and Hive connector jar in this PR, because they have been developed separately from Phoenix core in recent versions of Phoenix.
https://github.com/apache/phoenix-queryserver/
https://github.com/apache/phoenix-connectors/
I'll add them as different components in the future if needed.

----

I confirmed that this PR worked on CentOS 7 and Ubuntu 18.04, as follows:

* After building Phoenix, create a cluster using docker provisioner:

```
$ ./docker-hadoop.sh -d -k 'hdfs, hbase' -L -C config_centos-7.yaml -c 4
```

* Install Phoenix into the cluster manually (this process should be automated by Puppet in the future):

```
$ for i in $(seq 1 4); do
>   ./docker-hadoop.sh --exec $i yum install -y phoenix
>   ./docker-hadoop.sh --exec $i ln -s /usr/lib/phoenix/phoenix-server.jar /usr/lib/hbase/lib/phoenix-server.jar
>   if [ $i = 1 ]; then ./docker-hadoop.sh --exec $i systemctl restart hbase-master; fi
>   ./docker-hadoop.sh --exec $i systemctl restart hbase-regionserver
> done
```

* Make sure that the installed Phoenix works (use `python3 /usr/lib/phoenix/bin/sqlline.py` instead on the distributions that `python` is neither an alias of `python2` nor `python3` by default, such as Ubuntu 18.04):

```
$ ./docker-hadoop.sh --exec 1 /usr/lib/phoenix/bin/sqlline.py

(snip)

Connected to: Phoenix (version 5.1)
Driver: PhoenixEmbeddedDriver (version 5.1)
Autocommit status: true
Transaction isolation: TRANSACTION_READ_COMMITTED
sqlline version 1.9.0

I tested this on docker provisioned CentOS 8 env. hadoop-aws is loaded only if HADOOP_OPTIONAL_TOOLS contains the entry. HADOOP_OPTIONAL_TOOLS can be specified via command line or configuration files such as hadoop-env.sh.

```
# hadoop fs -ls s3a://iwasakims-test/

# HADOOP_OPTIONAL_TOOLS=hadoop-aws hadoop fs -ls s3a://iwasakims-test/

+1, also tested on Debian 10. Thanks @iwasakims!

I confirmed the followings with this PR:

* Building Zeppelin and its smoke tests succeeded, at least on CentOS 7 and 8 (it's also supposed to succeed on Debian 10 and Ubuntu 18.04).
* The following interpreters just worked:

  * %spark (though I had to specify both `spark.master` and `spark.submit.deployMode` separately for Spark 3. See https://zeppelin.apache.org/docs/0.9.0/interpreter/spark.html#configure-yarn-mode-for-spark-3x)
  * %livy.spark
  * %file (HDFS)
  * %python
  * %r (installing knitr is required, or disable the zeppelin.R.knitr flag)
  * %sh

For other components (Alluxio, Elasticsearch, Flink, HBase, Phoenix), Zeppelin doesn't work well only by specifying component versions via the -D option, due to version/API/protocol mismatch etc. But addressing them seems to require some time, so I'd like to postpone them as follow-up issues and submit this PR as the first step.

got expected result on Ubuntu 18.04 too.

+1, also tested on CentOS 7 and Debian 10.
I deployed the built package with docker provisioner ignoring path errors and had to rewrite the KMS port (16000 -> 9600) in core-site.xml, but they should be fixed in BIGTOP-3505.

I tested this on CentOS 8 by following cmdline:

```
./docker-hadoop.sh \
  --create 1 \
  --image bigtop/puppet:trunk-centos-8 \
  --memory 16g \
  --repo file:///bigtop-home/output \
  --disable-gpg-check \
  --stack hdfs,kms \
  --smoke-tests kms
```
+1, smoke test also succeeded on CentOS 7, Debian 10 and Ubuntu 18.04. Thanks @iwasakims!

I tested this by following command on CentOS 8. `--smoke-tests httpfs` seems not to work since there is no resouces under bigtop-tests/smoke-tests/https while there is code under bigtop-tests/test-artifacts/httpfs.

```
$ ./docker-hadoop.sh \
   --create 1 \
   --image bigtop/puppet:trunk-centos-8 \
   --memory 16g \
   --repo file:///bigtop-home/output \
   --disable-gpg-check \
   --stack hdfs,httpfs

$ ./docker-hadoop.sh --exec 1 curl "http://localhost:14000/webhdfs/v1/?user.name=root&op=LISTSTATUS"

Thanks for working on this, @sekikn.

```
ln -s /usr/lib/phoenix/phoenix-server.jar /usr/lib/hbase/lib/
```

Should this symbolic link be contained in the phoenix package? Creating the symbolic link by scriptlet could be an another option.

```
[root@b0e6cfbecc83 /]# /usr/lib/phoenix/bin/sqlline.py
env: â€˜pythonâ€™: No such file or directory

I got this error on CentOS 8 bacause python2/python3 was not installed. The phoenix-client RPM should requires python3?

```
$ rpm -qlp output/phoenix/noarch/phoenix-5.1.0-1.el7.noarch.rpm 
/etc/default/phoenix
/usr/lib/phoenix/phoenix-pherf-5.1.0.jar
/usr/lib/phoenix/phoenix-server-hbase-2.2-5.1.0.jar
/usr/lib/phoenix/phoenix-server.jar
```

* Should this package be phoenix-server rather than phoenix?
* There seems to be no init script using the /etc/default/phoenix.

```
$ rpm -qlp output/phoenix/noarch/phoenix-client-5.1.0-1.el7.noarch.rpm 
/etc/phoenix/conf.dist
...
/usr/lib/phoenix/bin/traceserver.py
```

* /etc/phoenix/conf.dist seems not to be used.
* traceserver.py looks not client-side module. It will not work because relevant Java classes are not contained in phoenix-client.jar (nor phoenix-server.jar).
LGTM. +1.
Thanks, @evans-ye. I merged this.
